A quick way to see why Individual 9 must be “Aa” (and not “AA” or an X‐linked genotype) is to note that three siblings in the middle generation (Individuals 3, 6, 7) are affected while both parents (Individuals 1 and 2) are unaffected. Under complete penetrance, this rules out an autosomal‐dominant trait (because one parent would have to be affected if three offspring inherited a dominant allele). It also makes X‐linked explanations untenable (for instance, X‐linked‐dominant inheritance would force all daughters of an affected father to be affected).

That leaves autosomal‐recessive inheritance, in which affected individuals are “aa.” Hence Individuals 3, 6, and 7 are aa. Since Individual 3 (aa) marries an unaffected partner (Individual 4), who must carry at least one normal (“A”) allele, their children can only be “aa” (affected) or “Aa” (unaffected carrier). Individual 9 is unaffected, so the only possibility is “Aa.” 

Thus, the correct choice is:

(B) Aa.

First, note that the angles given (53° in the plastic and 37° in the air) are measured with respect to the horizontal interface, so their angles to the normal at the interface are actually 37° (in plastic) and 53° (in air). Using Snell’s law,

n₁ sin(θ₁) = n₂ sin(θ₂),

where n₁ is the refractive index of the plastic, n₂ = 1 (for air), θ₁ = 37°, and θ₂ = 53°, we get

n_plastic = (sin 53°) / (sin 37°) ≈ 1.33.

Since the speed of light in a medium is v = c / n, then

v = (3.00 × 10⁸ m/s) / 1.33 ≈ 2.26 × 10⁸ m/s.

Comparing with the provided choices, the correct answer is (D) 2.26 × 10⁸ m/s.

• Going from medium 1 to medium 2, the ray bends toward the normal.  
  – This indicates n₂ > n₁ (the index in medium 2 is larger), so v₂ < v₁.  

• Going from medium 2 to medium 3, the ray bends away from the normal.  
  – This indicates n₃ < n₂, so v₃ > v₂.  

Finally, by inspecting the relative angles in media 1 and 3 in the figure (the final angle in medium 3 is larger than in medium 1), one sees n₃ < n₁, so v₃ > v₁.  

Putting it all together gives v₃ > v₁ > v₂, which corresponds to choice (A).
